subject: p17189198
Findings: Frontal and lateral chest radiographs demonstrate moderate interstitial pulmonary edema. The heart size is moderately enlarged, there are moderate bilateral pleural effusion. There is no lobar consolidation. The aortic contour is mildly tortuous. Embolic coiling material is seen in the mid abdomen on the lateral view.
Impression: Moderate pulmonary edema, cardiac silhouette enlargement, and pleural effusions suggest CHF. No evidence of lobar pneumonia.
